dialogues.text: Now a MORTAR appears through the turret and FIRES a ROCKET that EXPLODES over the Reb soldiers, illuminating the field. As soldiers shield their eyes from the blinding light...

dialogues.speaker: AERIAL SHOT
dialogues.text: Unbeknownst to the Rebs, Loveless has mowed and stained the field with concentric lines to give it a giant dart board appearance. Suddenly the TANK TURRET OPENS FIRE on them. Once over their initial shock, the Rebs FIRE BACK with their Springfield RIFLES. But the BULLETS PING off the tank's impenetrable skin like goober peas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lippenreider is viewing the carnage through large binoculars on a stand. General McGrath turns from the rail and faces Loveless, outraged. McGRATH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you sawed-off sadistic bastard! You've betrayed us! Loveless turns to him, cocks his head. LOVELESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dear General, after donating half my physical being creating a weapon capable of doing this... how did you and General Lee repay my loyalty? You surrendered at Appomattox! So, who betrayed whom? Loveless turns to Munitia holding a steno pad. LOVELESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Munitia, make note. Turret speed needs to be accelerated! MUNITIA (to Amazonia)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Change gear ratio from 2.2 to 2.8! Amazonia pushes a sick dignitary away from the rail so she can get a sight line to the tank with her lantern semaphore. She begins flashing the new gear ratio.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: AMAZONIA A bucket for the minister, please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now in the b.g., we hear the GATLINGS OPEN UP. Lippenreider is reading the lips of the tank's victims. LIPPENREIDER Scream. Scream. My head. I'm dying. Scream. Moan. Scream. McGRATH Loveless, I demand you give the order to stop this slaughter now! LOVELESS (ignores him) ... We're going to need more loading drills! I'm hearing too much time between screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Munitia scribbles dutifully, McGrath shoves her aside. He pulls his pistol. McGRATH For the last time, give them the order to desist!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loveless, his back to him, is seemingly unconcerned at having a gun barrel pressed against his skull. LOVELESS General, I understand your distress. But believe me, those men are not dying senselessly. It is for a far greater cause than you can imagine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Loveless's right index finger finds a black button on the arm of his wheelchair...

dialogues.speaker: LOVELESS'S WHEELCHAIR ARM
dialogues.text: The steel tubes that comprise the armrests are actually shotgun barrels facing fore and aft. McGrath's finger tightens on the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McGRATH Go straight to hell, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILD WILD WEST - Rev. 4/9/99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LOVELESS After you... sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOOM!!! McGrath has a very startled expression as he looks down at the aftereffects of DOUBLE-OUGHT BUCKSHOT. As he crumples to the deck, Loveless sniffs. LOVELESS Bloodbath McGrath indeed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dignitary's DOG starts BARKING, jumps to the deck. It sits next to the fallen General's gramophone ear and cocks his head. With the RCA logo invented we MOVE BACK TO...

dialogues.speaker: LOVELESS
dialogues.text: He sighs at his pale guests. They don't seem to appreciate the efficiency of his slaughter. LOVELESS Well, that concludes the festivities. Ladies, feed him to the crabs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Munitia and Amazonia unceremoniously dump McGrath's BODY overboard. SPLOOSH... Loveless addresses the dignitaries... LOVELESS But, my friends, that tank is just a little ol' toy compared to what this country's greatest scientists are cooking up for me next. So if I've piqued your interest, bring 1000 kilograms of your country's gold to Spider Canyon four days from now. (starts to roll off boat) Now if you'll excuse me, I've got a tank to catch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black waits ominously on the tracks. It's less a traditional train car than a riveted, armored, turreted f on wheels. Also, it currently lacks an engine. Loveless, over his shoulder to the foreign contingent...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LOVELESS My destination is both the future... and the past! Forget Paul Revere, this will be the most revolutionary ride in the history of America!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks dotingly at the TANK, which CLATTERS up from the battlefield on its treads... then drives onto the tracks. Wheels drop down out of the chassis, the treads retract up, and the TANK BACKS INTO the rest of the TRAIN. CLANK. It's a neat modular fit. Black death on rails. The foreigners watch with awe as...

dialogues.speaker: LOVELESS
dialogues.text: wheels up onto the tank/train. He drops the expansiveness, fixes them with a viper's eye. LOVELESS If you don't want to miss the ride, have the last payment of 1000 kilograms of your country's gold in my hands no later than Friday. That's when I make our little proposal to President Grant. One I'm ever so confident he's gonna accept. (now a jaunty wave of his hat) Au revoir, adios, and ta-ta!

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: It's quiet.    The dead men are all in the #9 or #10 ring Now a rider ENTERS FRAME...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West slowly dismounts, transfixed by the slaughter on the pre-fab battlefield. There's something hauntingly familia about all this for him -- the mangled bodies, the tread m But we'll find out about that later. West draws his weapon and begins walking through the victims. The pace of his search quickens when he isn't finding what he's looking for -- General McGrath.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON AND RITA
dialogues.text: have arrived in the one-horse carriage. Gordon is trying to recreate the crime scene. Rita trails behind him, his coat thrown over her shoulders, trying not to gag as she passes the mangled corpses. GORDON It came up out of the lake... from the way these corpses are positioned, laid down a 360-degree pattern of cannon fire... then disappeared in moments. (puts a foot on a body, scratches his chin) My God, what kind of weapon is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita can't handle Gordon's clinical posturing. RITA Excuse me, I think I'm going to be sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she walks quickly away, West comes over, a haunted look on his face. WEST It just rolls on and on. Makes a screeching sound -- like a wounded animal. Got a 'cabin' on top with a cannon... swivels 'round like an eagle's head. GORDON You saw it? WEST Heard about it. Thought it was crazy survivors' stories. GORDON What survivors? There aren't any here. WEST New Liberty, Illinois -- the free slave town just over the border. Just one week before the War ended in '65. I was in the 9th Cavalry that discovered it. Old men, women, children... they used them for target practice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE WILD WILD WEST - Rev. 6/15/98

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He looks out at the battlefield as if reliving it. Gordon is sympathetic to his obvious pain -- just shuts up. West's grim reverie is interrupted by MOANING coming from the shoreline. They all follow the sound to find...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General McGrath, washed up on the shore. West looks down at him. Now Rita, still looking green around the gills, rejoins the party. WEST That's when I vowed to follow McGrath to the end of the earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As grey as four-day-old mullet, McGrath manages a smile for his relentless pursuer. McGRATH (barely audible) What's the matter, West? Thought you'd be happy to find me... like this. WEST I was hoping to kill you myself. RITA That's a nice way to talk to people. McGRATH You'll have to live with it... As I've lived with the blame for New Liberty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McGrath fades out.    West grabs him and shakes him. WEST What do you mean? McGRATH (opens eyes) It was Loveless... his plan. He operated the killing machine there. Smarter now... left it to others here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the meaning of it all sinking in, West grabs McGrath by the collar and pulls him toward him. WEST Where is he?   Where did he go?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE WILD WILD WEST - Rev. 6/15/98

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The General tries to speak. West puts his ear to the General's mouth. But before he can say it, McGrath closes his eyes for the last time. West's shoulders sag.    Then from behind... RITA (O.S.) Well, I know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West turns to her... well? RITA I'll tell you if you take me along. WEST (in no mood) Just tell me. RITA The girls at the mansion. They talk. (imitating a la Lippenreider) 'I vonder if my hair vill get frissy in ze desert...? Vhere is diss Ooo-tah anyvay?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As West and Gordon turn to one another in alarm... WEST/GORDON Ooo-tah?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West and Gordon climb up onto the Wanderer and enter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West and Gordon burst in, surprising Coleman, who's got his feet up, perusing the Playboy of the day -- a mail order catalogue. WEST Coleman... let's go!    Full speed ahead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West snatches the catalogue out of his hands, does a take at the pictures of chunky models in bloomers. COLEMAN Aye, sir!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: As Coleman quickly exits, Gordon looks out the window, onto the platform. GORDON (wistful) I don't see why we couldn't have given her a ride back home to Texas. It is on the way... WEST On the way to Utah where our President happens to be. Maybe we oughta be worryin' about that little coincidence!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the ENGINE ROARS to life...

dialogues.speaker: WANDERER
dialogues.text: Rita gives a forlorn little wave as the TRAIN CHUGS away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON We wouldn't have known where Loveless was going if it wasn't for her. Seems a bit ungracious. Possibly perilous. WEST Look, all that would happen would be she'd get in our way and I'd probably wind up gettin' in the saddle with her. GORDON Funny that you say that. Because I thought she was more interested in me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita disappears from view in a cloud of steam...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West has every weapon on the train out for cleaning and loading. Gordon is in the galley where he continues his conversation with West while preparing dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE WILD WILD WEST - Rev. 6/15/98

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GORDON (O.S.) (from gallery) You know, I've been trying to place myself in Loveless's shoes... WEST Good luck on that one. GORDON (weakly) Ha, ha, ha... You know, I can't imagine what Loveless -- a man without any reproductive organs could possibly want with Rita.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly there's a WHOOSH and Rita falls through the ceiling and plops in the chair just like West did earlier. He instinctively pulls his gun. Puts it away as Gordon muses about her anatomy. GORDON (O.S.) (not realizing she's there) Not that Rita doesn't have a figure that would inspire a Botticelli... or a Raphael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita raises an eyebrow, looks to the galley as Gordon comes out with a platter of food. He still doesn't see her there. GORDON ... especially her breasts. Did you notice the way one of them... (cups his hands) Both of them actually... to say nothing of her buttocks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon turns and looks into the car. Finally sees her. Changes gears without missing a beat. GORDON ... and the group of foreign ministers at Loveless's party... What were they doing there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon gestures for West to join him at the pool table. Rita immediately goes for the food.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GORDON (using pool balls) Here's France, Spain and Britain... (sotto voce) How long has she been here? WEST Since the first breast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon turns to her, exasperated with himself. GORDON I am so embarrassed. WEST I'll spare you. (to Rita) Make yourself a sandwich to take with you. You're getting off.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: & 84

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita hasn't even waited for anyone's approval to start eating. West shakes his head at her chutzpa. RITA But... I can help you. WEST How could you possibly help us? RITA Well, I heard you talking about why all those foreign guys were at Loveless's party...? You want me to tell you? GORDON By all means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She uses the time to get another bite into her mouth. RITA (to Gordon, chewing) This is fantastic. You can cut it with a fork! How'd you cook it?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GORDON (someone appreciates him) Well, in a daubiere... a clay pot. A French method which...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West cuts off the chit-chat. WEST What about the foreign guys?! RITA They were mad about something, you know? Something about a real bad deal in Louisiana on purpose. GORDON The Louisiana Purchase? RITA And Queen somebody-somebody of France got swindled. GORDON Queen Isabella of Spain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West rolls his eyes. WEST Gordon, this is crazy. She doesn't know what she's talking about!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West picks up the speaker horn and calls Coleman. WEST (into speaker horn) Coleman, stop the train! Miss Escobar's getting off. COLEMAN (V.O.) (over pipe) Who the hell's Miss Escobar? RITA (grabs horn) I'm a frightened, starving, half- naked young woman who only wants to find her father! COLEMAN (V.O.) (over pipe) Half-naked?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WEST (grabs it back) Coleman... stop the train. COLEMAN (V.O.) (over pipe) We're not puttin' anybody off. Not out here in the middle of nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West looks out the window. Nothing but sagebrush and animal skulls out there. Rita comes up close to Jim, fire in her big, brown eyes. RITA Please, Jim. My father's the only family I've got. What am I supposed to do? Sit home and wait for news he's been killed? Or go do something! What would you do, Jim?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That gets the man of action where he lives. WEST Look, I got nothing against you, Rita. It's just that... What's going to happen when we catch up to Loveless... with you on the train?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs West's hand. RITA I know you'd never let him take me back. I've seen you shoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West kinda melts a little. This girl does have her charms. Gordon, a little jealous, puffs his chest out. GORDON I assure you, Rita, an attack by Loveless would be an exercise in futility. (stands for tour) ... Allow me to demonstrate how my design suggestions have made the Wanderer impervious to attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West draws his guns, twirls them and reholsters. WEST I'm the impervious part.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GORDON Hardly. Completely armor- plated...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artemus raps his knuckles on the wall making a METALLIC sound. Then he smugly demonstrates that the light fixture is actually a Gatling gun. GORDON An attacker would find the lighting inside extremely... unflattering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally he moves to the billiard table, while Rita nods ... and keeps eating. GORDON And if, by some inconceivable fluke, they did manage to gain entrance... (rolls billiard ball into bumper) An innocent billiard ball this way. (picks it up, presses the number) But depress the number... a sleeping gas bomb. Effective in under three seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon unclicks it, triumphantly rolls it into a pocket. GORDON So rest assured, Rita... you are completely safe within these walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West snorts at his obvious play for Rita's attentions. WEST I don't know about you, ma'am, but I know I'll be sleeping a whole lot better tonight... (yawns) ... assuming Loveless barges in here and feels like a game of pool. RITA Speaking of sleeping, I'm pretty tired. Artemus, do you think I could borrow something to wear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West jumps in before Gordon can answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILD WILD WEST - Rev. 4/9/99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WEST I've got somethin' you might use. It ain't stylish, but it's practical...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West and Gordon have bunked down on opposite couches, both deep in thought. WEST Loveless kidnapped two chemists, that means there's gonna be explosives. He's got a metallurgist, so there's gonna be heavy armor. And he's got Rita's father, who -- according to you -- is the world's foremost specialist in hydraulics. Which means, whatever it is... it's gonna move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West sits up. WEST So what, is he building that's gonna make the President fall to his knees and surrender the country? GORDON A bedside heater. WEST What? GORDON Rita. She    needs a bedside heater. I mean, it   gets cold in there, you know, with   the stained glass window right over   the --

dialogues.speaker: COLEMAN
dialogues.text: opens and Rita emerges from the state room... (INSERT RITA'S BUTT HERE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita leaves... GORDON Such a pleasant girl.   A real breath of fresh ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILD WILD WEST - Rev. 4/9/99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WEST You said ass. GORDON Did I?   No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon and West react as Coleman's voice booms out of the pipe. COLEMAN (V.O.) (over pipe) We have Loveless, gentlemen! Seven hundred yards and closing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they scramble for boots, weapons, Rita comes out of he room. RITA What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon ushers her to the back. GORDON Stay back here, take cover!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, West pulls on his boot. When he stands on it, a three-inch STILETTO SNAPS out of the toe. WEST What the hell is this? GORDON I took the liberty of installing it while you were sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West looks at him incredulously. WEST Leave my stuff alone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loveless's TANK/TRAIN CHUGS into a mountain tunnel. The Wanderer is just behind it... and goes into the tunnel seconds later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wanderer BLASTS out of the tunnel. (In the f.g. we might notice a metal post that extends up OUT OF FRAME.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coleman squints ahead.   He sees the tracks up ahead are empty. No Loveless. COLEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I missin' somethin' here...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up on metal stilts. It lets the Wanderer pass underneath it. Then it lowers itself back down onto the tracks. The legs fold to the side, and the tank/train pursues its pursuers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loveless turns to his three distaff warriors. LOVELESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amazonia, shall we disabuse our friends of the notion that one's problems are solved when we see the light at the end of the tunnel! As Munitia swivels the cannon barrel...

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: thru 97

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West and Gordon are about to head forward when Gordon glances out the back, grabs West.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE WILD WILD WEST - Rev. 6/15/98

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GORDON Jim, we're the ones chasing Loveless, correct? (as West shoots him a look) Then perhaps you could explain what they're doing behind us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As West looks out the back too... KA-BOOM!! A SHELL EXPLODES just to the right of them. Now ANOTHER EXPLOSION to the left of them. The Wanderer rocks precariously from wheel to wheel, throwing a screaming Rita back and forth between West and Gordon. WEST They couldn't fire the cannon at us from in front. Any other questions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West jumps up on the pool table. WEST Would it put you out too much to throw me a rope and hit your little secret button?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a shrug, Gordon tosses West a rope and hits the same hidden button he had during their fight. Whoosh! West is gone as the pool table flips over. As Rita covers her mouth in amazement... GORDON I taught him how it worked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West hanging upside-down. He hand-over-hands himself back to the escape trolley. He slides his back on top of it -- then lowers it onto the track. Little wheels fit on the inside of the track. Once coupled, West releases the cable and he shoots backwards -- OUT OF FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon opens a panel in the floor and snaps up a winch with a large handle. He starts to crank it, slowly letting out cable.

dialogues.speaker: WANDERER
dialogues.text: Out the back door, we see West emerge from under the Wanderer heading for Loveless's tank/train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly there's a PING! BONG! PING! POP! The TEETH of the GEARS can't take the pressure and they're flying off the WINCH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon, realizing another invention of his needs some tweaking, snaps out his pen and pad. As he scribbles a note, Rita considers the exotic pen holder. RITA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know you could put a gun on that thing. Gordon looks up at her disapprovingly... not you too? Meanwhile, on the tracks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off his wire tether, he flies backwards at 80 mph.

dialogues.speaker: WANDERER
dialogues.text: It looks like his head's about to be smashed by Loveless's tank/train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita turns away, buries her head in Gordon's shoulder just as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West slides under the train! He lies flat as the death MACHINE ROARS over him. At the last second, he lassos the rope around the rear axle. It slows him for a beat... then stretches. He's gotten Gordon's trick rope. We see his silent scream -- "Artemus!" He slides way behind the tank/train, then springs back... past the tank/train. Finally, West slides back underneath and manages to grab hold of their caboose. He swings his legs up, pulls himself around onto the step. THE WILD WILD WEST - Rev. 6/15/98                       7

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: West makes his way forward to the smokestack. He tries to flip the flue closed, steam scalding his hands. He doesn't see Hudson come at him from behind. He wraps a garrote around West's neck, pulls it tight -- practically crushing his larynx...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Munitia is bent over, has her eye to the cannon sight. As she squints through the smoke at the Wanderer up ahead Loveless, sitting behind her, has his full attention focused on her tuchus. MUNITIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have them square in my sights, sire. LOVELESS (distracted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As do I, Munitia... as do I. (looks up, wry smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire away! But it's a little difficult with him stroking her buttocks. BOOM! The CANNON FIRES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon and Rita are looking out the back when they see the latest missile headed their way. Gordon pulls Rita down at the last second as a huge steel arrow shoots through the door, past their heads... and into the parlor wall. As metal barbs flick out, locking the tip in, and the steel chain it's attached to draws tight...

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: West and Hudson roll around precariously. West claws desperately at the garrote. It looks grim for our hero until he knocks his boot heels together. CLICK... his STILETTO BLADE appears. Summoning his last ounce of strength, he mule-kicks... sinking the blade into Hudson's leg. West grabs him and shoves him head first into the smokestack. The big Indian plugs it up like a cork in a bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loveless has only a moment to gloat over his marksmanship before the compartment begins filling with smoke. Choking clouds that send Loveless et al into coughing fits. LOVELESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close the fire door! Just in time, Amazonia swings it shut as the unvented BOILER EXPLODES, sending a FIREBALL ripping through the back of the train, destroying it. Up ahead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon and Rita are thrown across the car, along with everything else inside, as Loveless's train's sudden stop... jerks them with it. The SCREECH of STEEL WHEELS SCRAPING on IRON RAILS is sickening. They clutch onto one another... as the Wanderer skids to a stop. As they pick themselves up, Gordon looks to Rita who's shaken up and scared. Now FOOTSTEPS coming up the stairs. RITA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't let Loveless take me again! I'd rather be dead! GORDON (recalling West's words)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not a good one to wish for. To defend herself, Rita grabs one of the sleeping-gas pool balls rolling around on the ground. Gordon leads her into the stateroom to lock her in, but she grabs his hand. RITA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Artemus, don't leave me alone! Rita closes the door behind him and locks it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon and Rita on the bed. FOOTSTEPS APPROACH. Gordon gestures to be still. The door handle jiggles. Rita gets ready to arm the POOL BALL.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WEST (O.S.) (hoarsely, not sounding like him) It's me, Jim. Open up! RITA It's a trick, I know Loveless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLICK, she pushes the number.     Gordon makes a grab for it. GORDON Rita, no!   It's just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLUNK... she drops it to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: WEST
dialogues.text: standing in the doorway. He rubs a raw welt on his neck from the garrote, smirks when he sees Gordon on the bed with Rita. But his smirk drops when he sees the pool ball roll between his feet -- spewing a purple cloud of sleeping gas. West gives Gordon a Wile E. Coyote look, croaks... WEST Too damn late, is what it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sea of corn tassels waving in the wind. Loveless's destroyed train is in the b.g. The CAMERA TILTS DOWN to find...

dialogues.speaker: WEST AND GORDON
dialogues.text: lying on the ground with their BACKS TO us. They stir. West props himself up, looks over at Gordon, who has just regained consciousness. WEST (mimicking him) An innocent billiard ball this way, but depress the number and on impact... a sleeping-gas bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West shakes his head disparagingly and stands. He feels the metal band around his neck and surveys the 18-inch wire fence which has been laid around them in a circle. West is about to step over it. Gordon grabs his leg.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GORDON Don't move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loveless is sitting in his wheelchair, fifty yards from West and Gordon. On Loveless's elbow sits Miss Lippenreider. She looks through binoculars and lip reads West and Gordon. LOVELESS Continue, Miss Lippenreider... MISS LIPPENREIDER (doing both voices in a monotone) West. Let go of my leg! Gordon. Listen to me. Loveless collared us with the same metal device we found on Morton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loveless turns to Munitia, who is loading two 36-inch- diameter metal discs into what looks like a CD changer/clay-pigeon-thrower. LOVELESS Oh, Munitia... I hope we're not going to leave evidence behind like we did last time. MUNITIA Nitro this time, sire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she arms the device, and a red light comes on... LOVELESS (through megaphone) Good morning, gentlemen! I trust you slept well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West and Gordon squint through the corn, see Loveless on their train. GORDON What have you done with Rita?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LOVELESS Rita, is it? How familiar! Rita is sleeping off the after-effects in the stateroom. (looks toward bedroom) Quite lovely, isn't she? Who knows... I might even become 'familiar' with her myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon takes a step.    West stops him. WEST And that would become one more reason why I'm going to kill you. LOVELESS Yes, Mr. West, I'm sure a well- endowed blackamoor like yourself must find it absolutely impossible... that a freak like me could fully enjoy the pleasure of a woman. But having witnessed my use of mechinology so far... wouldn't you think I could provide myself with something for the lower half of my body that was hard-pumping and indefatigably steely?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loveless looks O.S. LOVELESS ... And speaking of 'hard pumping...' Mr. Coleman, full steam ahead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the engine room.    Amazonia has a gun to his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loveless takes his last shot at them from the back. LOVELESS What a marvelous train! You don't mind if I borrow it, do you, gentlemen? (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LOVELESS (CONT'D) Other than a lack of wheelchair access, I find it a most comfortable way to pass the long miles from here to my laboratory in Spider Canyon... (louder, as they move off) I'll be seeing President Grant soon at Promontory Point. What shall I tell him for you? I'm afraid it can't be that you're alive and well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as his maniacal giggle hangs in the air...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: frustrated, as the train pulls away from them.    West tu at the metal collar around his neck. WEST Gordon, get out your little tool kit and get this damn thing off of me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon unbuttons his shirt to reveal his leather tool kit... empty except for a note. Gordon opens it and reads. GORDON 'Gentlemen, welcome to the Loveless Experimental Camp for Political Dissidents. There are no guards. No barbed wire. As long as you stay within the designated perimeter, you will stay alive.'

dialogues.speaker: BACK PLATFORM
dialogues.text: Miss Lippenreider is still eavesdropping for Loveless, through binos. MISS LIPPENREIDER West. How do you know it's not just bullshit? Gordon. Step over the fence and find out. Rita and I will put flowers on your grave every year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: stands next to the little fence, watching Loveless escape. WEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have time for this. GORDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, I have an auxiliary tool kit! Gordon peels back the top of his boot revealing it. But it's too late. West has jumped over the fence. Then he hops back inside it. He holds his hands out to Gordon. WEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See?     Nothing happened. West grabs Gordon by the back of his vest and yanks him over the fence. Now they hear a slight BUZZING in the air and it's not a bee.

dialogues.speaker: DISC
dialogues.text: comes whipping over the corn straight for West's head. In a split second, he ducks and the disc cuts the tops of the corn off and banks around for a new attack. GORDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, really...? Now both of them step over the fenced perimeter and start running like hell through the cornfield. WEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it too late to take it off of me now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second disc machine light turns green and the second disc is launched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loveless is laughing his head off. Certain of Gordon's and West's impending death, he rolls his wheelchair inside. THE WILD WILD WEST - Rev. 6/15/98                       7

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is awakening from the effects of the billiard ball gas and tries to control her sense of dread and loathing. She smiles nervously at Loveless, who's being fawned-over by his women. MUNITIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caviar...? LIPPENREIDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blini...? LOVELESS (opening champagne bottle)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita, my dear, not that I'm ungrateful to Providence for bringing you back to me... Rita jumps as the champagne CORK POPS. LOVELESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I'm just a wee bit curious as to how you managed to wind up with them. RITA (scrambling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, they uh... seemed so... sure that they could find you... and I thought if I stayed with them... they'd lead me back to... all my friends... Munitia shoots a look at Lippenreider. RITA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And not to give you a big head but... (wrinkles her nose to Loveless)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I kinda missed you. LOVELESS (not buying it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that a coincidence?    I miss me, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: come running TOWARD us. Behind and above are two discs about to make a dive at them.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The discs, like giant razors, are mowing off the tops of the corn stalks, heading straight for their heads! West and Gordon dive to the ground... the discs just missing them. West stands to run again. We see the back of his head's been buzzed.

dialogues.speaker: WEST AND GORDON
dialogues.text: running a zigzag pattern toward the end of the cornfield. West sees a gully fifty yards ahead of them. GORDON Head for that gully!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West zigs out of the cornfield one way. Gordon zags out the other. They're both beat-up and exhausted from running and flopping on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: breathlessly reaches the edge.      And looks down.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: It's no gully. It's a canyon that drops 100 feet down to a ribbon of brown water. And that's not the worst of it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West is on the other side of the precipice.       They're separated by about 15 feet of air. They both see the discs closing in.       Think fast. WEST When I give the signal.   Jump off the cliff into my arms. GORDON Are you crazy?! Do you see what's down there? WEST (watching the discs approach) Five, four, three, two...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West holds out his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILD WILD WEST - Rev. 4/9/99

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GORDON Forget it.   I'm not doing it... WEST One...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West takes a leap of faith... and finally, so does Gordon. GORDON Oh shit!

dialogues.speaker: PARTNERS
dialogues.text: meeting mid-air. They drop OUT OF FRAME, just as... the two discs collide with a MIGHTY EXPLOSION that is heard by...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loveless raises his glass to Rita, makes a little kissing gesture. She looks like she'd like to kill herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: are still in mid-air, both looking down. GORDON I just remembered... I can't swim! WEST You won't have to!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drop OUT OF FRAME and we hear a LOUD THUK THUK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: stuck up to their necks in red riverbed mud.      As they slowly begin to extricate themselves... WEST Maybe I should have stayed inside that fence another moment or two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILD WILD WEST - Rev. 4/9/99                            7

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West and Gordon, caked in mud, are coming up a ridge, below which is a stream. WEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Gordon, what's your plan? How are you gonna get this damn thing off my neck? Gordon turns to West, simmering, controlling himself. GORDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me? WEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that why you're here? 'Cause you're the master of, you know, mechanical stuff? GORDON (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Oh, I see. Now I'm the master of... 'mechanical stuff.' As opposed to five minutes ago, when I was trying to collect my thoughts and figure out a way to get us out of these contraptions! But no! Gordon starts moving towards West, who is forced to back up -- looking a tad nervous for the first time in the movie. GORDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- That wouldn't have been any fun for a certain somebody, and I won't mention any names -- Jim West! -- who decided to take me on a bracing romp through a cornfield and play a fanciful game of hide and seek with serrated, spinning death discs, while our only mode of transportation is in the hands of a sadistic madman with weapons of mass destruction, who kidnapped Rita, and is on his way to kill our President and take over the country! WEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, calm down, Gordon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILD WILD WEST - Rev. 4/9/97

dialogues.speaker: A137 CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GORDON (he's completely lost it) No! Because I'm the 'Master of Mechanical Stuff!' And I have to help YOU! Because you're the 'Master of Stupid Stuff!'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon... GORDON You want to get that collar off? Fine! Let's do it the fun, Jim West way! (picks up a rock) Let's bash it with a rock! WEST Gordon, you don't want to do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crazy) Oh, but I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon grabs a rock and smashes West's collar. Suddenly -- ZIIIINNG! West's collar emits a LOW HUM. Suddenly, West is thrown into Gordon, their collars locking.

dialogues.speaker: CLANG
dialogues.text: GORDON (suddenly calm) That's odd. What did you do? WEST I didn't do shit! GORDON No, you must've reversed the polarity of the magnets. WEST I did not do shit! (he's had enough) That's it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West lifts his leg to Gordon's collar to push him away, but then -- CLANG! The stiletto in his shoe dislodges and instantly sticks to Gordon's magnetic collar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILD WILD WEST - Rev. 4/9/99

dialogues.speaker: A137 CONTINUED
dialogues.text: For a mega-millisecond, West -- his foot stuck to his partner's neck -- is stunned. But before he knows what even happened, West flips upside down onto his shoulders. GORDON Are you all right? WEST Oh, I'm peachey. Now help me get my boot off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First, Gordon -- trying to get some leverage -- puts his foot in West's crotch and pulls the boot. WEST Ahhhh! GORDON Apologies, apologies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon struggles to free the writhing West from the boot (attached to Gordon's collar). Finally, West's foot comes free. But when he sits up -- THWAP! His collar is sucked into Gordon's belt buckle. West is face to face with his partner's crotch. WEST Do me a favor. When you're telling this story to your grandkids, leave this part out. GORDON Don't worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West starts unbuttoning Gordon's belt. WEST Now, when I undo your belt, I'm going to run as fast as I can that way, and you run as fast as you can the other way. Understand? GORDON You're going to run as fast as you can one way and I'm going to run as fast as I can the other...? Ingenious. WEST One... two... (undos belt) Three!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILD WILD WEST - Rev. 4/9/99

dialogues.speaker: A137 CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The men run in opposite directions. (Gordon's belt on West's collar, West's boot on Gordon's). They get about thirty, forty yards. Then -- They're yanked backwards into each other. SPLASH! They fall in the water -- back to back. Every time one rolls up and catches his breath, the other is under water. WEST (rolling face up) Get off me, you steaming pile of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON (rolling face up) I'm trying, you son of a (GURGLE)! WEST GORDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally they roll out of the stream and onto dry land. They sit up, out of breath, stuck together, back to back. WEST I do not want to spend the rest of my life looking like a meatball on a plate. GORDON We're going to have to discuss bathroom etiquette soon. Very soon.

dialogues.speaker: TOOL KIT
dialogues.text: bobbing in the stream.    Gordon grabs it out of the wate GORDON Aha. My auxiliary tool kit. I forgot all about it. It must've slipped out of my pocket. WEST Your pocket? Why wasn't it attached to some spring-loaded something-or-other that shoots out of your ass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILD WILD WEST - Rev. 4/9/97

dialogues.speaker: A137 CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GORDON Because that, my friend, would be uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon, lips parched, clothes tattered, peers impatiently over the metal collar as West works on it with some lock picks. West's collar is already off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILD WILD WEST - Rev. 09/03/98

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WEST Why didn't you tell me you had an 'auxiliary' tool kit? GORDON I did tell you, but in your zeal to run and leap off a two-hundred- foot cliff, I don't think you heard me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West eats the grilled Gila monster voraciously. And eats. And enjoys it more. And eats. He notices Gordon watching him. WEST What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon looks to the heavens and recites. GORDON '... Take physic, pomp; Expose thyself to feel what wretches feel, That thou mayst shake the superflux to them, And show the heavens more just.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon's quote has gone on.       And on.   And on.   He West watching him. GORDON What?! WEST You know, Gordon, you can be quite annoying -- flaunting that fancy education. GORDON Well, truth be told, I never had a fancy education -- not a formal one, anyway. WEST (looks at Gordon's ring) The Harvard thing seems pretty formal to me. GORDON This ring? This ring isn't real. Do you want it? (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILD WILD WEST - Rev. 09/03/98

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GORDON (CONT'D) (takes ring off and tosses it into fire) A prop. I'm an actor. Or was. I gave it up. I went by the name of Arthur Gordon. Ever hear of me? WEST No. How did you wind up in this line of work? GORDON The pinnacle of my life in the theater came in a production of Our American Cousin -- a light comedy -- at Ford's Theater in Washington. There was this one line I had... always got the biggest laugh in the show. One night, it drowned out the gunshot that killed President Lincoln. (beat) I decided to devote my talents to making sure that never happened again.

dialogues.speaker: TARANTULA
dialogues.text: walks slowly across West's outstretched hand. GORDON Uh... There's a spider on your hand. Doesn't that bother you? WEST She doesn't want any trouble. She's just trying to get warm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts the spider down into the sand. GORDON How come you know so much about the desert, anyway? WEST The Indians taught me. I lived out here when I was a boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon starts to ask West something but West doesn't want him to pry further.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILD WILD WEST - Rev. 09/03/98

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WEST Hey -- watch --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points toward a small black wasp flying from above. WEST The desert wasp... one of the world's great hunters. She'll kill the tarantula -- and lay her eggs on it, so her babies can have something to eat. GORDON Now I'm really hungry. (beat) How did your parents, who I assume were Negroes, feel about you being raised by Indians? WEST They didn't have much to say about it. I was sent to another plantation when I was little. Ran away as soon as my legs were strong enough to take me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West can see the effect his story has had on Gordon. GORDON Did you ever see your family again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE WILD WILD WEST - Rev. 8/28/98

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WEST Yeah... (stands, kicks out fire) They were at the camp at New Liberty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now they both stare into the fire.    Finally Gordon speaks. GORDON I'll help you get him, Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West and Gordon trudge through an endless sand dune, side by side, chests out, jaws set. They're partners, goddammit! GORDON You have no idea where you're going, do you? WEST I know exactly where I'm goin' ... Spider Canyon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon stops to catch his breath. WEST (stops, looks back) But I'm never gonna get there with you draggin' that damn thing around!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we see Gordon's got the heavy metal collar in his han West grabs him and they start to walk away -- Gordon listing noticeably. GORDON While a magneto of this power may not inspire your scientific curiosity, it does mine. Besides, you never know when it might come in handy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon suddenly disappears OUT OF FRAME. West stops to see what's happened to his partner now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE WILD WILD WEST - Rev. 8/28/98

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: He's on his back, arm holding the metal doughnut straight out over his head, being dragged across the desert floor by some unseen force. Gordon snowplows backwards through the sand for 40 feet, finally coming to an abrupt stop with a metallic klang! West deadpans this bit of insanity, walks over, and with the toe of his boot, uncovers the explanation -- iron railroad tracks covered by drifting sand. WEST Arte... when you're right, you're right. GORDON Well I think our partnership is taking a big step forward. You finally admitted I was right about something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West helps him up. Then, as or two heroes follow the tracks into the distance... towards Spider Canyon... GORDON Now... how about admitting you were lost? WEST Don't push it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West and Gordon trudge past the Wanderer.     It's parked at the end of the line, looks deserted. GORDON Jim, I know I've hallucinated it several times before, so is that really the Wanderer? WEST That's the Wanderer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon seems relieved to know his beloved train is not another mirage. They continue on to the rim of the canyon, peer over the edge. Reacting to what they see... GORDON And would it be too much to hope that I'm simply seeing a World's Fair down there... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE WILD WILD WEST - Rev. 8/28/98

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WEST Yeah, it would. That's Loveless' Lair.

dialogues.speaker: RIM
dialogues.text: A natural bowl that appears to have been made by a meteor, is gouged out of the desert floor. In the bowl are several spectacular Victorian-style buildings made almost entirely of glass, plus a huge silo. Ant-sized figures are moving around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now they hear a strange sound. To modern ears, a WHINE as from a jet engine. Loveless appears in the f.g. He's rising on a steel platform as if on some unseen elevator. Up, up, up he goes... as now more of the contraption come INTO VIEW. Alloy girders, multi-levels, control boards... all open in an Eiffel Tower-like effect. West and Gordon scramble for cover behind a rock as a giant metal Tarantula steps over the rim in full terrifying glory. Eight legs, five stories high. The thorax of the giant spider bristles with Gatling guns and all manner of weaponry. As the shadow of the monster passes over their faces... GORDON Now that's impressive. WEST Nice to see an invention that actually works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loveless is sitting in a captain's seat 60 feet in the air. He's surrounded by his adoring crew Amazonia, Munitia and Lippenreider. He spreads his arms wide, world at his feet.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON AND WEST -
dialogues.text: They watch the Tarantula head toward a narrow opening between two red-rock outcroppings. GORDON (dismissive)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll see about that. The fool doesn't even realize he's trapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly... a VOLLEY OF CANNON FIRE EXPLODES the impediment to dust. The Tarantula marches on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West is dressing for battle. He straps his six guns on his hips, flips the pool table over, grabs a coach gun, tucks that behind his chaps. He belts on his shotgun shell bandolero. An extra six gun gets tucked in the belt. Another in his boot. Pocketfuls of shells. The man's ready for war. WEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon, let's ride! (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do know how to ride...? He sticks his head through the door to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon's Nitro-cycle is out.   Gordon fusses with it and some canvas. WEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... A horse, I mean. GORDON (distracted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... I know how to ride a horse. When the situation calls for something primitive.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WEST How about now? There's a big spider stompin' towards our President!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Gordon won't be hurried. He has a big book out, studies it, then looks back to his Nitro-cycle. GORDON I was just thinking about another spider. Remember in the desert, when that little wasp killed the tarantula...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West rolls his eyes impatiently. WEST Yeah. Well, the wasp had a small advantage. It could fly. GORDON Exactly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon excitedly shows the book to West. Pictured is an archaic sepia diagram of a weird aircraft. West looks at it in disbelief as Gordon prattles on manically. GORDON In 1540, Leonardo Da Vinci invented a flying machine called the 'Ornithopter.' Though he never actually flew it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West's heard enough.    He grabs Gordon, shakes him. WEST Artemus! There's no time for plans or half-cocked inventions! They don't work. We gotta stick to what we're each good at!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As West drags Gordon to the wardrobe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two riders galloping TOWARD CAMERA. As they THUNDER PAST, we see West is in the lead, jaw set. And right behind him comes... President Grant...?! (It's Artemus in disguise, of course. And he actually can ride a horse.) THE WILD WILD WEST - Rev. 6/15/98                       8

dialogues.speaker: GOLDEN SPIKE
dialogues.text: being held in the stubby fingers of Ulysses S. Grant. He's reading an inscription on it. PRESIDENT GRANT (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May God continue the unity of our country... CAMERA PULLS BACK to reveal a crowd present to watch President Grant knock in the famous spike. Behind him, two train engines are facing each other. The detectives scan the crowd for possible trouble. PRESIDENT GRANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... as this railroad unites the two great oceans of this world. Now he swings back the sledgehammer... but at the top of his swing...

dialogues.speaker: SPIKE
dialogues.text: starts to shake, wiggle, and actually pop out of its hole. Very curious. As it begins to hop on the ground, bounced by a RESOUNDING THUMPING...

dialogues.speaker: GRANT AND CROWD
dialogues.text: look across the desert to see...

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The Tarantula in full view. People start screaming in terror as it appears over a ridge, huge even at this distance. The metal beast closes the 200-yard distance in seconds. The citizens flee. The detectives are not far behind them. The soldiers take cover and ready their weapons. Grant stands his ground... even as a huge FOOT CLOMPS down in front of him, VIBRATING the CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loveless talks into a microphone which BOOMS his voice out through AMPLIFIED SPEAKERS.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LOVELESS Well, isn't this a coincidence! I'm out for a little mornin' ride, and right in the middle of nowhere, I bump into General Ulysses S. Grant himself! (leans over edge, mocking salute) We've never been properly introduced. I'm Dr. Arliss Loveless, formerly with the Confederate Army.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Cool and collected, Grant lights a cigar. PRESIDENT GRANT Yes, Dr. Loveless, what can I do for you today? (to his military aides) Flank him, left and right. LOVELESS I have a humble abode nearby, and I hope you'll accept my hospitality. I have a little proposition to make. PRESIDENT GRANT What proposition is that? LOVELESS The unconditional and immediate surrender of the United States of America to the Loveless Alliance. PRESIDENT GRANT I didn't realize we were at war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loveless gives the nod to Munitia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KABOOM! The CANNON blows the President's train to smithereens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loveless giggles.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LOVELESS How about now...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd who'd taken refuge behind it runs away in panic. All but one of them. A second President Grant (Artemus Gordon). He calmly lights a cigar on the flaming train, strides up to the other Grant, and shouts up at Loveless. GORDON/GRANT In matters of war, the person to talk to would be me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If there's anyone more surprised than the President himself it's...

dialogues.speaker: POINT
dialogues.text: Loveless, squinting down at the two Grants. This new wrinkle has also attracted the attention of the Love-lettes and everyone else aboard. LOVELESS Now just who are you? GORDON/GRANT The President. (turns to President, snorts) He's just an actor hired to stand in for me on public occasions. A very bad actor, I must say... a little puffy and overweight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the President eyes him, puffs on his cigar, Gordon/Grant apes his every move, bigger, mockingly. PRESIDENT GRANT (aside) Gordon, you've got a lot of brass. Where's West? GORDON You know him, sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon/Grant shifts his eyes toward...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West running undetected to the rear leg. As the lone cowboy starts to climb up toward the belly of the beast..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon/Grant turns to an Army officer, standing behind. GORDON/GRANT (loudly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, get this man out of my sight! And next time get me a real actor! As the bewildered captain starts to lead the President away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loveless has had enough. LOVELESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take them both!!! Munitia, manning a sort of cannon, takes a bead on the two Grants. She pulls the trigger...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and a sticky white silk shoots out covering both Grants with spider web material. PRESIDENT GRANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Gordon... was this part of your plan? GORDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm by your side, sir.   That's what's important. Now Munitia hits a lever and they're hoisted up off the ground. They only get a couple of feet when... BLAM! West shoots the mechanism and it jerks to a stop. All eyes turn to the source of the sharpshooting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West has almost reached the lowest deck. Now all the firepower of the Tarantula is trained on him.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Amazonia's on the Gatling gun. Munitia and several other goons on lower decks OPEN UP on West, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West takes cover behind the steel girders, SIX-GUNS BLAZING. All his GUNS BLAZING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But West's bullets, as well as the Union soldiers' covering FIRE, PING harmlessly against the Tarantula's ALLOY SKIN.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGE
dialogues.text: grows impatient with the gun battle.   He pulls a lever.

dialogues.speaker: WEST
dialogues.text: Down below, nozzles on the Tarantula's legs suddenly ERUPT in clouds of skin-scalding STEAM. West screams in pain and falls... 30 feet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... to the ground, his head hitting a rock. As the two Grants witness it THROUGH the sticky spider ball...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loveless, wearing a black tunic festooned with medals and a Prussian-style helmet with a horse hair plume, raises his arms Nixon-like as a band plays a flourish. LOVELESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bonjour, buenas tardes and good day! Great glorious day! A day of healing for the wrongs that have been done to us all!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Framed by a large flag featuring the spider emblem, he looks out from center stage of a Greek theater at the crowd of foreign dignitaries seated around him. LOVELESS ... Oh, how long have we waited!

dialogues.speaker: AMAZONIA, MUNITIA AND LIPPENREIDER
dialogues.text: dressed in tight Fascist-brown tankwear, rise from their seats and applaud. The only people not applauding are a row of haggard, bearded scientists and the manacled prisoners Gordon (sans disguise), Rita, Grant and Coleman. LOVELESS (looks to Englishman) ... 1776, wasn't it, old bean? Most expensive cup o' tea in history...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Englishman dignitary nods soberly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West's body hasn't moved. The only change is that now a line of ants crawls across his face. We watch, hoping for a twitch, something... But there is none. The ants march over lifeless eyes, swarm onto the bloody cut on his head. If we're not convinced he's dead...

dialogues.speaker: VULTURE
dialogues.text: circles lower, finally landing right by West's head.   As the hideous carrion-eater leans over West's face...

dialogues.speaker: WEST'S EYES
dialogues.text: A shadow falls across them. But instead of the pecking red beak, a human hand appears IN the FRAME. Brushes the ants away. We hear an INDIAN INCANTATION over. Then finally... West's eyelids flutter open.

dialogues.speaker: NAVAJO SHAMAN
dialogues.text: standing over him. BLURRY, back-lit by the sun, the face of West's Indian friend. The healer who can turn himself into a bird.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: As West sits up groggily, feels his head. Hey, it's okay. As he makes a mental note to always be kind to animals...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loveless continues his speech to the foreign contingent. LOVELESS (looks to Hudson the indian) Manhattan for a handful of beads? (raises his hand; injun-style) How? (to the Mexicans) Remember the Alamo indeed! (humbly to crowd) Today I'm proud to be able to sit before you and tell you the wrongs will be righted... the past made present... the United, divided!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To thunderous applause. Loveless signals for the flag to be pulled down, revealing...

dialogues.speaker: MAP OF "THE DE-UNITED STATES"
dialogues.text: There have been some significant internal changes which Loveless now describes. The delegation from each country stands when they hear their name. LOVELESS Great Britain gets back the thirteen original colonies... minus Manhattan. (off applause) Florida and the Fountain of Youth go back to Spain! (off applause) Texas, New Mexico, California, Arizona revolve a Mexico! (off applause) And the Louisiana Purchase reverts back to the King of France!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the front row Rita leans over to Gordon. RITA Queen of Spain. King of France. I was close.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: MUNITIA (jostles her) Shut up and listen to a real genius!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally Loveless taps Colorado, Kansas, Utah and Nevada -- now labelled as "Loveless Land." Smiles impishly. LOVELESS And a tiny piece for me to retire on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's appreciative laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: stumbles in and looks around discouraged. The place has been ransacked. The gun cabinets are empty, the Gatling lamp removed. All that's left is Gordon's Nitro-cycle and his wardrobe full of dresses. West tries every secret hiding place. Nothing. Finally he finds Gordon's belt buckle/derringer. He opens the breech. Only one dinky bullet. He throws down the belt in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sits behind a desk that has been brought to center stage. Loveless unrolls a document, signs his half of it. LOVELESS My partner nations insist that we make this as legal as possible. Personally, I like the symmetry of it. After all wasn't it you who made us sign a surrender at Appomattox?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loveless snaps his fingers. Amazonia drags Grant out of his seat and sticks a pen in his manacled hands. PRESIDENT GRANT Never will I sign that paper, never will the United States ever surrender!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LOVELESS Well, sir, we're at loggerheads then, aren't we? And I suppose the threat of death to someone with your valorous war record, would mean nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant sets his jaw intractably.     He's right about that LOVELESS ... so, if you still refuse to sign this surrender... we'll start by shooting your man, Gordon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loveless whirls, nods to Amazonia who drags the President back to his seat, pulls Gordon out of his. Rita can't help her outburst. RITA Artemus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artemus smiles at her, extremely brave under the circumstances. He whispers to Rita and the President. GORDON (tugs at his vest) Don't worry, I'm wearing the Impermeable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita turns to Grant. What the hell is that? Gordon has no time to explain as Amazonia hauls him up on the stage. As Munitia aims her rifle... Gordon holds up a finger. GORDON If I may have one request... it's that she aim at my heart... which has loved this great country so much! LOVELESS (considers for a moment) Shoot him in the head. GORDON Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Munitia cocks her rifle, then just as Loveless holds his hands up for the signal to fire... the lights dim...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A candle-powered spotlight swings across the stage and illuminates... a deep-throated, bluesy black CHANTEUSE who starts singing the popular cathouse song, "Hangtown Gals." CHANTEUSE (singing) 'Ohhh... Hangtown gals are plump and rosy...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loveless wheels his chair around to take a gander and forgets Gordon's execution instantly. And why not? She's young and beautiful in a RuPaul sort of way. About six feet tall, wearing the blue sequined number Gordon had in his dressing room. Accessorized with black mesh stockings, big feather boa, silver-buckled belt, lots of frilly petticoats for those can-can moves. CHANTEUSE (singing) 'Hair in ringlets, mighty cozy...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She winds her finger around her ringlets and sticks out her derriere to the crowd. They stare, mouths agape at this piece of ass worthy of Othello.

dialogues.speaker: LOVELESS
dialogues.text: Intrigued.    Well, maybe more than intrigued. LOVELESS A new girl!   What a nice surprise!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He motions to hold up Gordon's execution, rolls to her. CHANTEUSE 'Painted cheeks and frilly corsets.' (bends over showing her undergarment) Touch them...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loveless hears this as an invitation, reaches out with his hand and whap! She slaps him right in the face. CHANTEUSE '... And they'll sting like hornets!'

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: There's a hush in the crowd. Loveless, a red handprint on his face, is a little nonplussed. Amazonia moves in threateningly, but Loveless stops her, starts to laugh. LOVELESS (making her name up on the spot) Ebonia! Why are you so cruel to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ebonia has escaped a head-cutting neck bracelet. But she probably shouldn't be teasing a man who's having "ghost aches" in certain amputated places.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: waiting to be executed.    Something's not quite kosher about her for Gordon. GORDON (musing to himself) I have a dress like that.

dialogues.speaker: CHANTEUSE
dialogues.text: Now with the crowd singing along, she pulls out all the stops. Her gestures and dance moves become more exaggerated, she's in the thrall of her audience. CHANTEUSE (singing) 'Hangtown gals are lovely creatures Think they'll marry Mormon preachers.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sashays over to the French dignitary, pulls his monocle out of his eye and blows hot breath on it, steaming it up. As she pops it back on his face... CHANTEUSE (singing) 'Heads thrown back to show their features...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now she puts her cheek next to Rita as if matching their relative beauty while picking the pocket of Lippenreider. Rita pushes her away disgustedly but not before Ebonia hands Coleman the keys to the cuffs. Coleman looks from the keys to Ebonia. He just caught on.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: COLEMAN Go, Ebonia, go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Ebonia prances on stage to Gordon, cuddles up to him. Gordon looks at the big beautiful black woman with a mixture of amusement and relief. Of course, it's his "I'd rather be dead" partner, Jim West. WEST (singing) Ha... Ha... Hangtown girls... GORDON Not to sound ungrateful, but you're a little over the top. WEST (sings) Ha... Ha... Ha...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West/Ebonia wraps the feather boa around Gordon's neck -- hiding the derringer in the palm of his hand. Gordon look worried. What's he going to do with a gun? As he tucks it up his sleeve... GORDON Let me warn you about that dress... WEST Gotta go. Big finish... (belts it out) 'Ha, ha, ha! Hangtown gals!!!'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An immediate standing ovation. The diversion allows Coleman to unlock both Grant's and Rita's shackles. Grant looks at the keys. PRESIDENT GRANT Where'd those come from...? COLEMAN (nods to Ebonia) Captain West.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their eyes practically pop out of their heads. RITA She's... no...!

dialogues.speaker: EBONIA/WEST
dialogues.text: One more time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE WILD WILD WEST - Rev. 7/1/98

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WEST (singing) 'Ha, ha, ha... Hang... Town... Girls!!!'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the tassels on his bosoms are spinning to the delight of the crowd. WEST (suddenly blinks) Wait a minute. What the hell is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops, but his tassels are still spinning on their own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Immediately two FLAME THROWERS EXPLODE from his cone-like bosoms. Maybe he should've listened about the dress. He turns to Gordon questioningly, and inadvertently incinerates one o Loveless's goons. He howls in pain, runs panicked... right into Rita. RITA Serves you right for staring at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she relieves the charred goon of his keys... Loveless turns to the rest of his goons. LOVELESS Kill him! (off their confused looks, points) Him! Him! The girl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally getting it, they rush Ebonia. Even his 4th of July breasts aren't a match for them. Desperate, West reaches way down in his undergarments to retrieve one of Gordon's billiard balls. He depresses the number and rolls it at the guards. GORDON Was that the eight ball? WEST Mmm-hmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon grabs West and Rita, pulls them behind the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE WILD WILD WEST - Rev. 7/1/98

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GORDON That one's an incendiary bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KA-BOOOOM! An EXPLOSION rips the place and a Santa Ana- sized fire starts immediately. Rita jumps up and makes her way through the smoke to a bearded SCIENTIST. WEST/GORDON Rita!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She unlocks his neck collar, turns to them and smiles. RITA (disappearing into the chaos) Meet me after the show!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both West and Gordon look after her with yearning as three goons charge them. Coleman, amazed at their torpor, quickly grabs a RIFLE from the incinerated goon and OPENS FIRE. BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! Three goons drop. Gordon and West exchange looks. Not bad for an emphysemic old engineer. COLEMAN Special Marshal... President thought you needed some lookin' after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speaking of the President... he's grabbed a dead goon's RIFLE, and is LAYING DOWN a pretty good field of FIRE himself. Suddenly, he gets a tap on the shoulder from behind. It's Amazonia. Whap, she sends a right to his chin knocking him out. She throws him over her shoulder and carries him away.

dialogues.speaker: DUSK
dialogues.text: As fire engulfs the place, Loveless has no choice but to retreat... for now. Surrounded by a cadre of his women, who carry the unconscious President Grant, Loveless heads through a round STEEL VAULT DOOR. As Amazonia swings the door closed, the foreign dignitaries BANG on the door begging for admittance.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: FRENCH MINISTER Monsieur, we are your partners! You can't let us die in this fire!! LOVELESS It's not the first time y'all have been burned in America.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He chuckles, nods to Amazonia, who SLAMS the DOOR closed.

dialogues.speaker: COLEMAN
dialogues.text: emerge from the smoking lair, coughing and gasping for breath. They watch helplessly as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAMBERS out of the bowl -- with Grant captive on the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLEMAN This is diabolical! They've got the President and I've still got that silly song in my head! GORDON (freaking out) C'mon we gotta go! We gotta ride horse! Something!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West is watching the Tarantula, turns to calm him. WEST No, Arte.   Right now, we need a plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon tries to compose himself. WEST That flyin' machine idea of yours... were you just acting like you knew what you were talking about... or could you build it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PANNING an expanse of canvas comprising a 20-foot wing span. In the b.g., we hear Gordon SCRIBBLING. GORDON (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Bernoulli's Principle states that the air flowing over a bird's wings... is moving at a lower pressure than the pressure below the wing... that's called 'lift.' Course, it's just a theory... it's never been tested.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON'S DRAWING
dialogues.text: It depicts a wing cutting through the air. Arrows indicating airflow. Circular lines indicating "life." Only one problem, it's upside down. Gordon remedies that. Looks sheepishly to West who, like him, is wearing a leather flight jacket and goggles. WEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not makin' me feel any better. Now they attach the wing to the frame -- which is connected to the Nitro-cycle. Coleman, his ever-present cigarette dangling from his mouth, readies bombs from the gunpowder of cartridges and Gordon's design. They look like Flash Gordon's spaceship. He passes them out. COLEMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's a coupla bon voyage presents. GORDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coleman! Must you smoke when handling explosives! Gordon grabs them away from him and sits in the saddle of the Nitro-cycle. West looks at Coleman apologetically as he stuffs the bombs into his jacket. WEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's just a little nervous 'cause no one's ever flown before. West is barely on the back when Gordon kicks it over and they BLAST OUT OF FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: builds ground speed. Gordon is nervous at the wheel. West gives him an encouraging pat. WEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Avant...! Avant!!! But their speed is not enough to get them airborne. GORDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not getting enough lift! We need more speed! Then in an uncharacteristic move by Gordon, he turns the machine around and heads for the cliff. WEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, uh... that's the cliff over there, you know? He guns the accelerator. GORDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I do know. And with that, the Nitro-cycle goes off the cliff! It disappears for the count of five. Then suddenly it swoops up and PAST CAMERA. They're flying!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GORDON (amazed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It worked...? It worked!! WEST (looking down)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you had to get one right, I'm real glad it was this one. GORDON (exhilarated, with West-like abandon)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeee-haaa! And with that, they bank the Desert Wasp around and fly off to save the Republic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is entering the town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loveless turns to Grant, his face beaten and bruised. LOVELESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President, I'll ask you once again. Sign the surrender or I decimate this town! PRESIDENT GRANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've had my answer. Loveless's face darkens as Amazonia hands him a tray of cotton balls. LOVELESS (as he puts in earplugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I find the sound of people screaming while they get blown to smithereens, ruins the ear for music. Don't you? He offers them to the President.    Grant swats them away LOVELESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commence firing! And with that the Tarantula OPENS FIRE on the town. There's a lot of stomping and smashing, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: high above the Tarantula. Gordon, lost in the joy of flight, turns to West who is more of a white-knuckler. GORDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'll call it... WEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme guess... an Elevation Enhancer? GORDON (why would you call it that?)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Air... Gordon. Now West points to the Tarantula and chaos below. WEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go down, down there!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GORDON (as if to a child) You can't just 'go down there.' Flight depends on lift, which must be calibrated to the angle of descent... WEST Shut up and go down there, will ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West reaches up, shoves the make-shift joystick forward. As the wasp plummets toward the bridge of the Tarantula and Gordon strains to keep control...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loveless and Grant are oblivious to our heroes above. unlocks one of Grant's handcuffs, presents him with a pen. LOVELESS Well, Mr. President. Have you had enough yet? Would you like to sign the surrender or shall we set a course for Denver? Wichita? Washington, perhaps?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly there's a LOUD WHOOOSH and...

dialogues.speaker: DUSK
dialogues.text: West and Gordon swooping down low. West unfastens BOMBS from his vest, waits for the right moment. As they swing past the Tarantula cannon, he drops them. BOOM! BOOM! The big gun falls limp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dumbfounded Tarantula crew, which has been whittled down to Miss Lippenreider, Amazonia and Munitia. They never counted on having to shoot something in the air, and can't raise their weapons any higher than 90 degrees.

dialogues.speaker: DUSK
dialogues.text: West and Gordon banking around for another sortie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loveless wheels his chair amid the smoke and chaos, shocked. WARNING HORNS are GOING OFF. PRESIDENT GRANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'll be damned... it's West and Gordon... flying! Grant chuckles at the dauntless pair's pluck. PRESIDENT GRANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep that surrender handy. I think you're going to need it! LOVELESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
